Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians led the Royals by just 3 1/2 games coming into this one. Unfortunately, what was a large lead has withered down, especially after losing the series to the Royals last week.
The Royals have dominated this series, going 7-3 against the Guardians through 10 games, including 3-1 at home.
The Royals are 6-4 against the run line against the Guardians.
The Guardians are 69-68 against the run line, while the Royals are 75-63.
The Guardians are 36-33 against the run line on the road, while the Royals are 38-31 against the run line at home, which is the best in baseball.
We trust Wacha more to get the job done and help the Royals cover the run line.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is on Monday, September 2, 2024, at 4:10 PM ET/1:10 PM PT.
The game will be televised on Bally Sports Kansas City and Bally Sports Great Lakes.
The game can be streamed on fuboTV (Free Trial).

The Guardians' offense must deliver, with Steven Kwan (.283 with 11 RBIs and 20 runs over 35 games against the Royals) and Jose Ramirez (.281 with 167 hits, including 31 home runs, 100 RBIs, and 105 runs in 162 career games against the Royals) being key players.
Bobby Witt Jr. has struggled against the Guardians, hitting just.205 with 26 hits, one home run, six RBIs, and 12 runs over 32 games against them in his career.
Salvador Perez is hitting just.242 with 19 home runs, 70 RBIs, and 56 runs over 144 career games against Cleveland.
Vinnie Pasquantino can make an impact and get on base to help his team thrive.
Wacha has had five quality starts in the last six games and hopes to add another one.
The Royals' bullpen has no established closer, with neither James McArthur nor Lucas Erceg having claimed it.
The Royals are 38-31 against the run line at home, which is the best in baseball.
